title: Ciara turns heads in a plush head-to-toe beige ensemble as she leaves her hotel in NYC
text:
She's known for her chiseled dancer's figure.

But Ciara kept her curves covered up on Saturday as she stepped out in a voluminous puffer coat in a matte camel color.

The Goodies hitmaker, 34, coordinated the rest of her outfit with her outerwear for an impossibly chic monochrome look.

Monochrome: Ciara kept her curves covered up on Saturday as she stepped out in a voluminous puffer coat in a matte camel color

Her ensemble included a collared button-up and a pair of wide-leg trousers with a boot-cut hem.

She added more height to her 5ft 7in frame with a pair of pumps in the exact same color as the rest of the getup.

The one-time muse of Givenchy kept her makeup glowy but minimal, finishing off her lips with a pink gloss and dusting her lids with a metallic bronze pigment.

Lush: The one-time muse of Givenchy kept her makeup glowy but minimal, finishing off her lips with a pink gloss and dusting her lids with a metallic bronze pigment

Cute: Ciara, full name Ciara Princess Harris, kept her black long bob haircut pressed silky straight and fashioned into a half-up, half-down style

They went for it: The sighting comes hours after the singer shared several photos of herself and husband Russell Wilson disguised as Beyoncé and Jay-Z for Halloween

Ciara, full name Ciara Princess Harris, kept her black long bob haircut pressed silky straight and fashioned into a half-up, half-down style.

The sighting comes hours after the singer shared several photos of herself and husband Russell Wilson disguised as Beyoncé and Jay-Z for Halloween.

'Jay & Bey,' Ciara captioned the photo that garnered over 1M likes within its first 10 hours of posting.

On-screen: Ciara and Wilson also posted a short music video clip of themselves in costume performing as the power couple with plenty of lip-syncing action involved

Action: 'From the Wilsons to the Carters to the Obamas... Much Love & Respect. We goin Ape $#!% #HappyHalloween,' the Body Party songstress captioned the music video

'From the Wilsons to the Carters to the Obamas... Much Love & Respect. We goin Ape $#!% #HappyHalloween,' the Body Party songstress captioned the music video.

The couple took the video over the top with a portrait of Barack and Michelle Obama in the background.
